meanings.sent1: The bunny was very skippy as it hopped around the garden.
meanings.sent2: The children were skippy and full of energy during recess.
meanings.sent3: The skippy squirrel quickly climbed up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her skippy dance moves made everyone smile at the party.
meanings.sent5: The skippy movements of the kangaroo were mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.sent1: Mom bought a jar of Skippy peanut butter for sandwiches.
meanings.sent2: I prefer Skippy peanut butter over other brands for its taste.
meanings.sent3: The Skippy peanut butter jar was almost empty, so we needed to buy more.
meanings.sent4: The creamy texture of Skippy peanut butter spread easily on the bread.
meanings.sent5: The smell of Skippy peanut butter always reminds me of childhood lunches.

meanings.definition: A nickname or term of endearment.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa always called me Skippy when I was little.
meanings.sent2: She affectionately referred to her cat as Skippy.
meanings.sent3: Hey Skippy, can you pass me the remote control?
meanings.sent4: The old friends greeted each other with a warm 'Hey Skippy!'
meanings.sent5: Skippy, let's go on an adventure together and explore the woods!
